citation.article-title: Pseudorhodoferax soli gen. nov., sp. nov. and Pseudorhodoferax caeni sp. nov., two members of the class Betaproteobacteria belonging to the family Comamonadaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudorhodoferax caeni sp. nov.
Pseudorhodoferax caeni (cae′ni. L. gen. n. caeni of sludge, the source of the type strain).
Colonies are circular and white to light yellow.
Cells are motile rods, approximately 0.9–1.0 μm in width and 1.5–3.3 μm in length.
Negative result in tests for nitrate reduction, indole production and urease, protease, β-glucosidase, β-galactosidase and arginine dehydrolase activities.
Positive for the assimilation of d-mannitol, gluconate, malate, citrate, acetate, fructose, taurine, propionate and succinate.

Negative for growth with d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, inositol, sorbitol, rhamnose, sucrose, arabinose, adipic acid, 3,3′-thiodipropionic acid, 3,3′-dithiodipropionic acid, l-cysteine, l-homocysteine, 3-sulfinopropionate, 3-mercaptopropionic acid, mercaptosuccinic acid and thiolactic acid.
The type strain, SB1T (=LMG 24543T=DSM 21598T), was isolated from activated sludge from the municipal wastewater treatment plant at Grüneck near Munich, Germany.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 70.1 mol% (HPLC).
